comments: Interesting class when I took it. Materials is fairly challenging! Most students at UCR are of his taste. Dr. Dearricott is seeking a more intellectual bunch and hence why he decided to visit UCLA.

Unclear during lectures, some interesting test problems (integral of cos^2 ? - double angle formula was needed..), For the final, he had some unsolvable problems. Basically your grade is composed of the midterm and final, which are both curved. \'B\' grade is achievable but an \'a\' is near impossible. avoid if possible..
You know those t-shirts that say "just do it" DONT DO IT! YOU WILL FAIL! I took AP calc BC in passed both BC and AB, but his midterm and final are IMPOSSIBLE! He doesnt help at all!
Very challenging, but fair prof. Engages students in a true study of mathematics with theory and practical applications. I enjoyed the course, but be prepared for heavy hw.

As a Computer Science Major I was worried about his class, but his willingness to clarify any confusion during lecture really helped me through the course. I am glad I chose to take him last quarter rather than wait another quarter for another professor

hmm..well, this class was kind of awful to say the least. i had taken ap calculus in high school and did great in the class, and 8b is basic calculus and i kept getting D\'s and F\'s on the midterms and somehow i pulled off an A in the class. It was a miracle. Bottom line, try to stay away from this teacher. You could definitely get a better teacher.

This professor is hard to understand during lecture! math is my subject and he is just unstructured and very unorganized in his lecture. i mean he is a challenging teacher if you are up to the challenge.
Professor was alright but he was all theory based. I did all my learning with my TA. Luckily I had a great TA.

Wow had a amazing quarter with him. It started off rough with alot of proofs, but just go to office hours and he helps alot. The key is come prepared to lecture and everything will make sense and you will learn alot. I recommend him as a professor he really challenges you as a student. I feel like I have the material mastered from his course.

WOW. This man is by far the worst professor I have ever had at UCR. His lectures are a joke. He just rambles on and uses the same examples for everything, and the examples he uses aren\'t even that understandable. Get this someone asked him a question and he said, and I quote "if you don\'t get it, you don\'t get it." DON\'T TAKE HIM!!
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! DOES NOT HOW TO TEACH. HE USES MATH TERMS THAT NO ONE UNDERSTANDS. HIS CLASSES CAN MAKE ANY "A" STUDENT, CRY AND WANT TO FAIL MATH. DON\'T TAKE HIM.
Extremely difficult assigns A LOT of HW and has very hard tests is a struggle to pass I did very well in my other math classes but this was a challenge I really do not recommend him
WORST PROFESSOR I\'VE I\'VE HAD!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS! I\'D RATHER TAKE A CLASS WITH SOMEONE WHO DOESN\'T SPEAK ENGLISH THAN TO HAVE TO SIT THROUGH ANOTHER ONE OF HIS LECTURES.
OMG! His final is really hard! I recommend all students to avoid his class, honestly. I\'m not being over dramatic or exaggerating.

I had professor dearicott for 10A and 9A. His lectures are very confusing because he teaches calculus in theory and only really demonstrates proofs. There is a massive curve however and its possible to get a good grade if you invest the time into studying.
read the book.. it is really hard to fallow in his lec.
Satisfied.

Course materials are fairly challenging. However, if one invested enough time into this class it is not hard to earn a descent grade. Professor Dearricott is helpful during office hour. I would recommend this class to anyone who truly wants to learn calculus.
OMG! THAT FINAL WAS THE HARDEST THING EVER! ~15% ON THAT FINAL + C- ON THE MIDTERM = B!!!!!!! IT\'S A MONSTER CURVE! However, the midterm determines your grade, not the final.

The class final was the hardest crap ever. I\'ve taken 8 AP classes in High school and they were like merry-go-rounds rides compared to this. The Final is SICK curved however, so there\'s still a chance that you can do well(ok, average, meh) in the class. Just don\'t expect to be able to retain your sanity. Prof wasn\'t as bad though...decent
